Experience Enjoying Life Early Retirement from Cisco July 2011  – Present (4 years 2 months) San jose Hi All, I have opted to take an early retirement package from Cisco Systems, and kick back for a bit. Please stay in touch. :-) Facilities Manager Cisco Systems 1996  –  July 2011  (15 years) San Jose 15 years of work at cisco. Lots of adventure and many reorginizations through rapid growth and contractions. Facilty CONSULTANT Applied Komatsu 1995  –  1996  (1 year) Santa Clara, Ca • Designed space plan solutions to increase number of offices by utilizing space more effectively.  
• Facilitated Applied Komatsu’s move to new campus of 450 offices and 30,000 sq. ft. lab space. 
• Created space management tool to track space availability and move sequences. 
• Determined vendor/supplier requirements and developed time-line for work performance Senior Planner Intel Corporation 1991  –  1995  (4 years) Santa Clara, CA • Managed and forecast space requirements for MPG and IT organizations.  
• Developed short-term and long-term space solutions based on historical data and trend analysis.  
• Earned division award for successful planning and execution of 525-office relocation project.  
• Partnered with interdepartmental team members to design process improvements which ensured smooth, timely project completion. Designer KBM Workspace 1989  –  1991  (2 years) San Jose, CA • Integrated AutoCAD into Design Department.  
• Redesigned and implemented plans to increase space utilization for Onizuka AFB, System 29. Summary Dedicated and loyal performer with focused experience in supply chain management. Balanced skills across multiple supply chain disciplines delivering quantifiable and measurable results. Experienced people manager with proven ability to influence and grow organizations. Strong leader with emphasis on motivating people to pursue common goals, values and vision to achieve excellence. Specialties:APICS Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) Summary Dedicated and loyal performer with focused experience in supply chain management. Balanced skills across multiple supply chain disciplines delivering quantifiable and measurable results. Experienced people manager with proven ability to influence and grow organizations. Specialties:APICS Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) Experience Outsourcing Program Manager Intel Corporation January 2015  – Present (8 months) Hilsboro, OR Program Manager responsible for ODM suppliers of SSD products 
Manage and negotiate $100M+ in supplier contracts 
Drive optimum supplier performance across material cost and availabilty 
Develop strategic sourcing strategies to deliver robust end product supply chain Strategic Supply Chain Ops Manager Intel Corporation May 2009  – Present (6 years 4 months) Drove cohesive supply chain processes across key production organizations focused on long term strategic plans.  
Project management focused on supply chain improvement utilizing Agile process 
Key member of supply chain team to design material supply chain for next generation process technologies and critical new markets 
Implemented cycle time improvement for critical product categories across planning, logistics/transportation, customs and factory network Planning Manager Intel Corporation September 2006  –  April 2009  (2 years 8 months) Responsible for the supply and demand process between the virtual factory network and the materials organization. Delivered key goal to ensure healthy and stable supply chain to meet operation needs through accurate demand management and commodity/supplier coordination.  
Managed team of planning analysts to establish dependable, accurate forecasting planning process through systematic elimination of waste, utilization of lean experiments and development of quantifiable metrics 
Influenced key stakeholders to properly resource planning organization by demonstrating value during difficult reorganization and declining headcount 
Expanded scope of deliverables to establish strong connection to break down silos existing between purchasing, planning, factory and materials management organizations Materials Senior Planner Intel Corporation April 2004  –  August 2006  (2 years 5 months) Lead supply and demand planner for direct materials. Managed build plan and strategic long range plan material commit process by serving as main interface between virtual factory network and materials operations.  
Initiated and developed long range forecasting process to improve strategic planning process  
Led and chaired business continuity planning team; executed strategies to enable recovery of core business materials due to unplanned disruptions by teaming with materials organization, factory and finance Commodity Manager Intel Corporation May 2001  –  March 2004  (2 years 11 months) Supplier manager responsible for commercial strategies of metal, chemical and quartz suppliers. Managed 7+ suppliers with $80M+ in annual spends; negotiated and created multi-year contracts and collaborations. 
Drove supply base to be recognized as preferred quality supplier status through performance management 
Teamed with customer base to create strategic sourcing strategies to enable next generation technology leadership; led Intellectual Property collaboration agreements through coordination with Intel Capital, legal and finance  
Created long range strategic programs including alternative low cost geography plans and consignment to ensure material availability for critical processes Senior Inventory Management Analyst US Airways May 1998  –  July 1999  (1 year 3 months) Primary analyst and strategic capacity planner for 20+ high revenue transcontinental market routes. Responsible for diagnostic reviews and allocation of flight inventory to maximize revenue per mile based on market dynamics and profitability. Conducted operational functions including scheduling and competitive analysis. Owner American Artisans May 1995  –  April 1998  (3 years) Founded and oversaw retail company to capture opportunity in targeted niche market. Marketed various works of art from over 200 different artists. Managed all aspects of the business including marketing, purchasing and employees. Established and expanded the business into two strategic branches in the Los Angeles area and achieved sales of $500K+/ year. Summary PROJECT MANAGEMENT PROFESSIONAL 
 
Strategic manager, specializing in business analysis and project management. Attain goals on time and within budgets. Analyze data, identify issues, and create solutions enhancing overall productivity. Able to lead teams with collaborative, engaging and thoughtful style, enabling solution development.

 Experience Senior Project Manager Blueprint Furniture October 2014  – Present (11 months) Greater Los Angeles Area • Created social media campaign strategy for mid size retail furniture business. Specifically, focusing on growing Pinterest, Instagram, and Facebook engagement. In 3 months, was able to have 10,000 unique monthly viewers on Pinterest boards.  
• Project lead responsible for mapping out entirely new e-commerce site. Collaborated with vendors to map out key products. Negotiated and hired web design and build team and an SEO team to ensure site ranking was optimized.  
 Sr. Manager Sales Planning and Project Management NBCUniversal, Inc. March 2012  –  October 2014  (2 years 8 months) Greater Los Angeles Area •	Oversaw sales forecasting systems and tools, executive reports, and key projects affecting sales, including acting as business owner for new forecasting / planning system using SAP BPC. 
•	Achieved yearly planning process on time with accountability for completing sales product slate, assigning product goals for each retail account, and ensuring final forecast plans fall within finance budget. 
•	Increased sales teams’ efficiency by launching multiple critical projects. Recent accomplishments include implementation of Shiloh software for Walmart team and designing sales advertisement database for the Target team. 
•	Prioritized needed developments by crafting early system enhancement roadmap in coordination with sales teams, senior management, and IT. Gathered system requirements, documented key requirements, ensured system changes met requirements, and did full User Acceptance Testing. 
•	Created solutions for 85% of identified sales force pain points in less than 3 months by serving as project manager of task force. Task Force consisted of Sales / Finance / and Marketing team members. Manager Business Process Improvement NBCUniversal, Inc. March 2007  –  March 2012  (5 years 1 month) Greater Los Angeles Area •	Improved sales forecasting and processes by implementing complete system overhaul and serving as strategic owner for system enhancement road maps. 
•	Aligned communications by creating scorecards and monthly roll up reports for sales and senior management. 
•	Increased sales productivity by devising process for sales to run ad hoc reports utilizing Essbase Cubes and Microstrategy reports. Assistant Category Manager NBCUniversal, Inc. February 2005  –  March 2007  (2 years 2 months) Greater Los Angeles Area •	Drove growth and created unique promotional opportunities by partnering with Costco and Blockbuster sales executives. 
•	Improved promotional effectiveness, developing promotional tracking tool, analyzing every promotion and product placed. 
•	Increased sales 30% for 2 consecutive years by refining execution of promotional activities. Category Manager Mattel February 2004  –  February 2005  (1 year 1 month) El Segundo, CA •	Helped buyer increase sales 3% even with category space declining by 10%, serving as category captain for all boys’ toys for Wal-Mart. 
•	Analyzed large amount of data, helping buyer understand how planograms, individual products, and seasonal set build sales were doing. 
•	Ensured sales and margin goals were met by consolidating toy space. Business Analyst Intel Corporation January 2001  –  January 2004  (3 years 1 month) Santa Clara, CA •	Helped redesign global planning system by leading business team. 
•	Defined and documented requirements and future process steps, working with management across Intel sites. Senior Planner Intel Corporation January 1998  –  2001  (3 years) •	Ensured marketing demand was met, supervising specific product line planning, working with supply chain, expediting materials, and creating multiple what-if scenarios based on market and price changes. Senior Project Manager Blueprint Furniture October 2014  – Present (11 months) Greater Los Angeles Area • Created social media campaign strategy for mid size retail furniture business. Specifically, focusing on growing Pinterest, Instagram, and Facebook engagement. In 3 months, was able to have 10,000 unique monthly viewers on Pinterest boards.  
• Project lead responsible for mapping out entirely new e-commerce site. Collaborated with vendors to map out key products. Negotiated and hired web design and build team and an SEO team to ensure site ranking was optimized.

Summary I have been successful in several industries by applying a strong work ethic and a great toolkit of knowledge to solve problems for my employers. Enjoy a challenging environment and do not mind change and fluidity in the workplace. Experience Senior Project Planner / Contractor Cisco April 2014  – Present (1 year 5 months) Greater Atlanta Area Work within a PMO organization as a specialist that focuses on helping projects get off to the right start. Work with Project Managers during the planning phase to help ensure the project is set up accurately from the very beginning via the use of PBS/WBS and comprehensive and dependable effort estimates. Help projects start off and then hand over command and control of the project to the Project Manager and his team once the project team has entered execution phase and has demonstrated sustainability in the command and control process. General Manager Southern Moulding LLC January 2010  –  January 2014  (4 years 1 month) Lead the Kennesaw based management team. Responsible for overall production of the Kennesaw warehouse as well as managing Southeastern sales territories and reps. Program Planner The Select Group 2014  –  2014  (less than a year) Operations Manager/Strategic Business Development Southern Moulding and Supply Company January 2007  –  August 2010  (3 years 8 months) Kennesaw, GA 30152 Oversaw daily operations and sales force while focusing on New Business development and Strategic Initiatives. Orchestrated the merger/acquisition with Decor Moulding. Business Operations Intel Corporation January 2005  –  December 2006  (2 years) •	Responsible for quarterly revenue goals. Coordinate pricing, supply and logistical support to ensure revenue targets are delivered on a quarterly basis. Group does over $100M in sales a year. 
•	Own demand forecasting for rolling yearly window, own communicating and quoting worldwide pricing for CEG product offerings and own working with distributors worldwide to support our supply chain initiatives and sales. Intel Supply Chain Network Strategic Capacity Planner Intel Corporation March 2002  –  December 2004  (2 years 10 months) Chandler, AZ •	Primary focus in on aligning Fab (wafer factory) capacity to Intel’s long term (5+ years) demand forecasts. Job involves cross functional cooperation between Marketing, Factory Capacity Planning and examining options for future expansion. The Strategic Capacity Planning group produces the roadmap for Intel’s future factory sites. 
•	Primary focus on the 300mm 90nm technologies. Strong focuses on the litho, C4 and Sort functional areas of the 300mm factory network. Fab 22 Senior Planner Intel Corporation June 2001  –  March 2002  (10 months) Chandler, AZ •	Northwood (Pentium 4) Product Planner in Fab 22. Coordinated wafer starts, tracking of WIP and performance to schedule for the wafer starts in Fab 22. Primary coverage for Fab 22 Planning Strategic Capacity Planner. Product Marketing Analyst-GRP Intel Corporation January 2001  –  June 2001  (6 months) Chandler, AZ •	Divisional planner for half of Intel’s i960 embedded processor family. Duties include demand forecasting, deriving and driving the build plan as well as helping develop marketing strategies for the product families. Fab 12 Planner Intel Corporation May 2000  –  January 2001  (9 months) Chandler, AZ •	Became the Pentium III product planner at Fab 12 in Arizona accounting for 40% of Pentium III production worldwide. Duties included WIP analysis, what-if scenario management for shipping schedules to Intel’s assembly and Test facilities around the world. As Superuser for the planning applications I drove two major implementation changes that allowed for easier and more accurate WIP analysis across Intel’s factories. Project Manager-Intern Intel Corporation June 1999  –  January 2001  (1 year 8 months) Chandler, AZ •	Organized and chaired the world wide delivery team charged with developing and implementing processes to reduce the occurrence and impact of offloads to Intel’s end customers.
